channel.title: IP hiding tool
channel.description: All right I found a website that will 'hide my IP'. I heard that things like these will give out my [i]real[/i] IP and my internet bill will skyrocket. Is this true? The website I'm going to use is http://www.hideyouripaddress.net/ - it was an advertisement on www.ip-address.com. What's the catch? Thanks.

item.dc:creator: @shinzo shinzo
item.description:
@shinzo wrote:

[quote=“SparkysWorld, post:18, topic:404994”]if (poster == uses_this) {
no-ip.com
poster == smart
} else {
poster == dumbass
}
}

[/thread][/quote]
ifz DA name = sparkysworld
fuckoff();
rep++?

Read full topic

item.title: IP hiding tool
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:13, topic:404994”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=502010.msg3676773#msg3676773 date=1311289898]
There’s no such thing as ‘hiding’ your IP.
[/quote]
It’s not called ‘Hiding’ and IP address, a lot of people get the same mistake all the time and don’t search the correct things. Try looking up IP bouncer, all reflects your IP off different locations around the world making it virtually impossible to find your IP address.

Although, don’t go doing crime while you’re through these tunnels, because the police have higher security than what you think and can track your original IP in seconds.[/quote]
Lol.

Protip: You’re thinking of onion routing.

Read full topic

item.title: IP hiding tool
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

T4_:

There’s no such thing as ‘hiding’ your IP.

It’s not called ‘Hiding’ and IP address, a lot of people get the same mistake all the time and don’t search the correct things. Try looking up IP bouncer, all reflects your IP off different locations around the world making it virtually impossible to find your IP address.

Although, don’t go doing crime while you’re through these tunnels, because the police have higher security than what you think and can track your original IP in seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: IP hiding tool

item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

ziplock:

No, it’s not true. The moderators of this site can read your real IP. If I were talking to you on MSN I could read your real IP.

Swear I’m in the UK, ah well.

Read full topic

item.title: IP hiding tool
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:404994”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=502010.msg3672856#msg3672856 date=1311047249]
No, it’s not true. The moderators of this site can read your real IP. If I were talking to you on MSN I could read your real IP. Truth is, there isn’t much I can do with it except Ddos it.

The site your using is a web proxy. Say you get on Google with it. It will take all the information you send, send it to a server, that server will send it to Google, Google will send the response to the server, the server will send the response to you. So that you can anonymously browse the internet, download something, or whatever you do. Proxies can always be traced back, although it’s defiantly not easy. You can use proxy servers without advertisements if you adjust your whole internet connection to go through one.
[/quote]

I believe proxy servers can only be traced back if they record the IPs of all clients connected to it. Otherwise, (if my understand is correct) you could make a proxy server that doesn’t record, or keep a log of the IPs to browse truly “anonymously”.[/quote]
They can be traced back with powerful tools, but if you are hosting proxys on proxys each ones makes it a lower and lower chance that anyone will be able to track it. Seven is a good number to start with but I got to say, it really does suck not having cookies when using a proxy.

Read full topic

item.title: IP hiding tool
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:6, topic:404994”]No, it’s not true. The moderators of this site can read your real IP. If I were talking to you on MSN I could read your real IP. Truth is, there isn’t much I can do with it except Ddos it.

The site your using is a web proxy. Say you get on Google with it. It will take all the information you send, send it to a server, that server will send it to Google, Google will send the response to the server, the server will send the response to you. So that you can anonymously browse the internet, download something, or whatever you do. Proxies can always be traced back, although it’s defiantly not easy. You can use proxy servers without advertisements if you adjust your whole internet connection to go through one.[/quote]

I believe proxy servers can only be traced back if they record the IPs of all clients connected to it. Otherwise, (if my understand is correct) you could make a proxy server that doesn’t record, or keep a log of the IPs to browse truly “anonymously”.

Read full topic

item.title: IP hiding tool
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

No, it’s not true. The moderators of this site can read your real IP. If I were talking to you on MSN I could read your real IP. Truth is, there isn’t much I can do with it except Ddos it.

The site your using is a web proxy. Say you get on Google with it. It will take all the information you send, send it to a server, that server will send it to Google, Google will send the response to the server, the server will send the response to you. So that you can anonymously browse the internet, download something, or whatever you do. Proxies can always be traced back, although it’s defiantly not easy. You can use proxy servers without advertisements if you adjust your whole internet connection to go through one.

Read full topic
